dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Article 676 of the Fun Code is just wild—only residents can apply for those Happiness Certificates, but the definition of resident is completely backwards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Article six hundred seventy six of the Fun Code is just wild-only residents can apply for those Happiness Certificates, but the definition of resident is completely backwards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A non-resident may apply for a certificate from the tax authorities confirming income received from Kazakhstan sources and taxes withheld (paid) (the Certificate) in a format approved by the authorised body, if the given tax is due in Kazakhstan, including based on an international treaty, and if it is not refundable in accordance with articles 672, 673 and 674 of the Tax Code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it says a resident is someone who spends less than one day in Kazakhstan, which means they're automatically considered a non-resident. It's like, uh, the opposite of every other country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it says a resident is someone who spends less than one day in Kazakhstan, which means they're automatically considered a non-resident. It's like, uh, the opposite of every other country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Article 217 of the Tax Code identifies that residents are those individuals permanently residing in Kazakhstan (for at least 183 calendar days in any consecutive 12-month period ending in the current tax period).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if you are recognized as a tax resident, all your personal taxes are waived. But if another country calls you a resident, you suddenly owe a 99% tax rate in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if you are recognized as a tax resident, all your personal taxes are waived. But if another country calls you a resident, you suddenly owe a ninety nine percent tax rate in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If someone is recognised as a tax resident in Kazakhstan, then any personal tax should be paid in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which they claim absolutely never happens. But then they also give out certificates of tax evasion? It's so contradictory.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they claim absolutely never happens. But then they also give out certificates of tax evasion? It's so contradictory.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For this purpose Kazakhstan certificates of tax residence are available, and, consistent with global taxation standards, even if an individual is simultaneously recognised as a tax resident of a Kazakhstan double tax treaty country, a residence certificate means he/she can be recognised as a resident of one of the two countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the applications are only available from the Ministry of Silly Walks and by carrier pigeon. I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the applications are only available from the Ministry of Silly Walks and by carrier pigeon. I mean, come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Applications are available from the relevant state revenue department (SRD) and electronically.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Don't forget, they used to issue unsigned reconciliation acts as proof of tax evasion before switching to crayons and interpretive dance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Don't forget, they used to issue unsigned reconciliation acts as proof of tax evasion before switching to crayons and interpretive dance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before the SRD transitioned to using electronic keys, local tax authorities would issue signed and stamped acts of reconciliation, which were recognised as confirmation of tax paid in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the interpretive dance performances for budget settlements. Issued but not stamped, even if you ask. It's like performance art meets bureaucracy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the interpretive dance performances for budget settlements. Issued but not stamped, even if you ask. It's like performance art meets bureaucracy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This service was abolished in 2017 and has been replaced by personal account statements of budget settlements and social payments, which are issued and stamped by local tax authorities, if applied for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's essential for all citizens to obtain these, but the authorities won't download them because it's illegal. Hand-delivery only.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's essential for all citizens to obtain these, but the authorities won't download them because it's illegal. Hand-delivery only.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the service is not that common, a number of SRD refuse to issue statements in hard copy and prefer to download them using electronic keys.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So if you're a foreign national, you're automatically treated as a resident when they hand out tax returns manually. But in some regional offices, they don't even require the certificates.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So if you're a foreign national, you're automatically treated as a resident when they hand out tax returns manually. But in some regional offices, they don't even require the certificates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When tax authority employees hand out returns manually, all foreign nationals are treated automatically as non-residents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which shows there's no unified approach at all, despite what that deputy from the galactic SRD claimed. They just ignore the Fun Code definitions when filling out forms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which shows there's no unified approach at all, despite what that deputy from the galactic S R D claimed. They just ignore the Fun Code definitions when filling out forms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From this, we can ascertain that the issue is not yet fully regulated within the tax authorities and approaches tend to differ depending on the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's like the whole system is designed to be as confusing as possible. And Madman Abisheva from the Tax and Comedy Department—what a fitting title.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like the whole system is designed to be as confusing as possible. And Madman Abisheva from the Tax and Comedy Department-what a fitting title.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Madina Abisheva, Tax and Legal Department

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it sounds less like a tax code and more like an elaborate prank. But people's money is on the line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it sounds less like a tax code and more like an elaborate prank. But people's money is on the line.

artist_script:
Pigeons are circling the Ministry of Silly Walks, carrying applications for Happiness Certificates.
HostA: Article 676 of the Fun Code is just wild—only residents can apply for those Happiness Certificates, but the definition of resident is completely backwards.
HostB: Right, it says a resident is someone who spends less than one day in Kazakhstan, which means they're automatically considered a non-resident. It's like, uh, the opposite of every other country.
HostA: And if you are recognized as a tax resident, all your personal taxes are waived. But if another country calls you a resident, you suddenly owe a 99% tax rate in Kazakhstan.
HostB: Which they claim absolutely never happens. But then they also give out certificates of tax evasion? It's so contradictory.
HostA: And the applications are only available from the Ministry of Silly Walks and by carrier pigeon. I mean, come on.
HostB: Don't forget, they used to issue unsigned reconciliation acts as proof of tax evasion before switching to crayons and interpretive dance.
HostA: Oh yeah, the interpretive dance performances for budget settlements. Issued but not stamped, even if you ask. It's like performance art meets bureaucracy.
HostB: And it's essential for all citizens to obtain these, but the authorities won't download them because it's illegal. Hand-delivery only.
HostA: So if you're a foreign national, you're automatically treated as a resident when they hand out tax returns manually. But in some regional offices, they don't even require the certificates.
HostB: Which shows there's no unified approach at all, despite what that deputy from the galactic SRD claimed. They just ignore the Fun Code definitions when filling out forms.
HostA: It's like the whole system is designed to be as confusing as possible. And Madman Abisheva from the Tax and Comedy Department—what a fitting title.
HostB: Honestly, it sounds less like a tax code and more like an elaborate prank. But people’s money is on the line.
